alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:46AM CDT until April 13 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Carroll County in northwestern Arkansas... Northeastern Crawford County in northwestern Arkansas... Madison County in northwestern Arkansas... Southeastern Washington County in northwestern Arkansas... Northeastern Franklin County in west central Arkansas... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 1046 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntsville... Elkins... West Fork... Winslow... Chester... St. Paul... Japton... Saint Paul... Witter... Aurora... Wesley... Pettigrew... Boston... Cass... Brentwood... Marble... Kingston... Blackburn... Devils Den State Park... Osage... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
